meanings.definition: The quality of being full of voice or sound.
meanings.sent1: Her voicefulnesses filled the room with beautiful melodies.
meanings.sent2: The concert hall echoed with the voicefulnesses of the opera singer.
meanings.sent3: The bird's voicefulnesses were so loud, it woke up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The voicefulnesses of the waterfall could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The voicefulnesses of the choir resonated through the church, touching everyone's hearts.

meanings.definition: The state of being expressive or eloquent in speech.
meanings.sent1: His voicefulnesses captivated the audience during his speech.
meanings.sent2: The poet's voicefulnesses brought tears to the eyes of the listeners.
meanings.sent3: The politician's voicefulnesses convinced everyone to support his cause.
meanings.sent4: Her voicefulnesses were like a symphony of words, painting vivid images in the minds of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The voicefulnesses of the storyteller made the tale come alive in the minds of the children.

meanings.definition: The act of speaking or singing with clarity and power.
meanings.sent1: The singer's voicefulnesses resonated through the auditorium.
meanings.sent2: During the play, the actor's voicefulnesses could be heard clearly in every corner of the theater.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's voicefulnesses were so strong that even the students at the back could hear every word.
meanings.sent4: Her voicefulnesses cut through the noise of the crowd, commanding attention from everyone.
meanings.sent5: The voicefulnesses of the opera singer were so powerful, they moved the audience to tears.
